IF YOU ARE NOT A FUNNY ONE, TRUST ME! I CAN MAKE YOU SMILE. MANY FRIENDS SAY I HAVE A POWER TO BRING THEM HAPPYNESS!

posts.title: 解决org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils中没有copyFile(File,OutputStream)这个方法或者使用这个方法报错
posts.excerpt:
原因commons.io版本冲突，使用了低版本1.4的，里面没有方法copyFile(File,OutputStream)。应该使用2.2的版本。
bug出现的背景小编使用kindeditor来实现文件上传，在KindEditor官网里面找到了安装包KindEditor 4.1.11 (2016-03-31) [1143KB]，网址如下http://kindeditor.net/down.php，小编用java开发，选择了jsp版本，在lib里面有三个文件，如下所示

小编使用maven管理所有使用的jar包，将上诉所有的jar包导入maven仓库后，坐标导入上述版本。然后BUG的种子就埋下了。
解决办法去掉maven坐标中的commons-io 1.4的版本即可。
posts.text: 原因commons.io版本冲突，使用了低版本1.4的，里面没有方法copyFile(File,OutputStream)。应该使用2.2的版本。 bug出现的背景小编使用kindeditor来实现文件上传，在KindEditor官网里面找到了安装包KindEditor 4.1.11 (2016-03-31) [1143KB]，网址如下http://kindeditor.net/down.php，小编用java开发，选择了jsp版本，在lib里面有三个文件，如下所示 小编使用maven管理所有使用的jar包，将上诉所有的jar包导入maven仓库后，坐标导入上述版本。然后BUG的种子就埋下了。 解决办法去掉maven坐标中的commons-io 1.4的版本即可。 原因详解不同版本的commons-io里面包含的方法不一样，去看看你自己用的哪个版本的commons-io吧！ 1.打开自己的org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils点击outline，或者在eclipse或myeclipse环境下crtl+o快捷键显示，如下，没有copyFile(File,OutputStream). 2.打开项目找到Maven Dependencies,查看里面的jar包,寻找commons-io,发现里面有一个commons-io-1.4的。再想一下它是怎么进来的，去pox.xml中寻找它的坐标。果然发现了它的踪迹。 3.在导入的包的继承结构中搜索commons-io发现存在一个版本冲突，commons-fileupload这个jar包关联的是commons-io:2.2这个版本的，maven仓库自动导入了2.2的jar包。根据图片上面的提示它被1.4版本的commons-io覆盖了。那么去掉1.4会发生什么呢？ 4.注释掉commons-io 1.4的版本，如下 5.commons-io : 2.2的版本被编译啦！而且Maven Dependencies里面存在的也是如下图2.2的版本 6.再去org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils查看他的copyFile方法，有copyFile(File,OutputStream)了，又可以开心玩耍啦！ 结语下次再发生找不到方法的时候，看看是不是工具包导错了，或者版本冲突被和谐了！

posts.title: 项目所遇BUGS
posts.excerpt: 1.创建maven project的war工程时遇到pom.xml第一行报错Cannot detect Web Project version. Please specify version of Web Project…如下12345Cannot detect Web Project version. Please specify version of Web Project through Maven project property <webVersion>. E.g.:<properties> <webVersion>3.0</webVersion> </properties>
posts.text: 1.创建maven project的war工程时遇到pom.xml第一行报错Cannot detect Web Project version. Please specify version of Web Project…如下12345Cannot detect Web Project version. Please specify version of Web Project through Maven project property <webVersion>. E.g.:<properties> <webVersion>3.0</webVersion> </properties> 在pom.xml的project标签内加入如下代码，指定maven war包的编译版本即可 1234567891011<build> <plugins> <plugin> <artifactId>maven-war-plugin</artifactId> <version>2.4</version> <configuration> <version>3.0</version> </configuration> </plugin> </plugins></build> 如果报错依然存在，关闭pom.xml;点击项目名右键，选择maven下的update project..,会跳出一个update Maven project勾选上刚刚建的这个项目，点击ok即可。 2.创建Maven项目后pom.xml报错“web.xml is missing and is set to true”在src下面创建文件夹WEB-INF然后再创建一个名为web.xml的.xml文件即可。 3.在Myeclipse中启动tomcat本地服务器报错： Unsupported major.minor version 52.0参考stackoverflow:https://stackoverflow.com/questions/22489398/unsupported-major-minor-version-52-0 原因：java的版本不搭配，java的编译环境使用的是JDK1.8，但是runtime运行环境使用的是更低的版本，比如JDK1.7，可在Myeclipse或者eclipse的windows中找到java下面的Complier和Installed JREs中查看，换成相同版本的编译器即可。 4.启动tomcat服务器报错：NoSuchBeanDefinitionException..Dependency annotations..1Caused by: org.springframework.beans.factory.NoSuchBeanDefinitionException: No qualifying bean of type [com.estrellahuang.bos.dao.CustomerRepository] found for dependency: expected at least 1 bean which qualifies as autowire candidate for this dependency. Dependency annotations: {@org.springframework.beans.factory.annotation.Autowired(required=true)} 原因是:未能自动注入CustomerRepository对象，有两个可能的错误： 一.applicatonContext.xml文件中未添加下面的代码，表示开始注解扫描。 12<!-- 扫描 @Server @Controller @Repository --> <context:component-scan base-package="com.estrellahuang"/> 二.没有在类名上配置注解，如下面的代码，在CustomerServiceImpl中使用了@Autowired自动注入CustomerRepository对象，但是没有调用CustomerRepository的任何方法，要知道Spring JPARepository是在使用的时候才会生成代理类对象的，所以下面的代码并没有生成一个bean，也就不存在于spring的容器中。 12345678@Service@Transactionalpublic class CustomerServiceImpl implements CustomerService { @Autowired private CustomerRepository customerRepository;} 123public interface CustomerRepository extends JpaRepository<Customer,Integer>,JpaSpecificationExecutor<Customer> {} 解决办法：在CustomerRepository实现类中添加@Repository ，或者先注释掉CustomerServiceImpl中 12/*@Autowiredprivate CustomerRepository customerRepository;*/ 等到使用这个对象调用数据库时再去掉注释，即可。 5.使用阿里大鱼开发短信验证功能，启动服务器报错Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.aliyuncs.exceptions.ClientException小编在调用阿里的API时，并没有引入com.aliyuncs.exceptions.ClientException这个包，但是在抛异常时用到了这个包，将抛出的异常由ClientException改为Exception就行。并将 1import com.aliyuncs.exceptions.ClientException; 这句话删掉即可。 6.使用kindeditor时导入jsp文件，启动并访问服务器报错org.apache.jasper.JasperException: Unable to compile class for JSP: An error occurred at line: 1 in the generated java file..具体报错信息如下： 1234567891011121314151617181920212223242526272829303132333435363738394041HTTP Status 500 -type Exception reportmessagedescription The server encountered an internal error () that prevented it from fulfilling this request.exceptionorg.apache.jasper.JasperException: Unable to compile class for JSP: An error occurred at line: 1 in the generated java fileThe type java.io.ObjectInputStream cannot be resolved. It is indirectly referenced from required .class filesAn error occurred at line: 93 in the jsp file: /pages/upload_json.jspArrays cannot be resolved90: }91: //检查扩展名92: String fileExt = fileName.substring(fileName.lastIndexOf(".") + 1).toLowerCase();93: if(!Arrays.<String>asList(extMap.get(dirName).split(",")).contains(fileExt)){94: out.println(getError("上传文件扩展名是不允许的扩展名。\n只允许" + extMap.get(dirName) + "格式。"));95: return;96: }Stacktrace: org.apache.jasper.compiler.DefaultErrorHandler.javacError(DefaultErrorHandler.java:92) org.apache.jasper.compiler.ErrorDispatcher.javacError(ErrorDispatcher.java:330) org.apache.jasper.compiler.JDTCompiler.generateClass(JDTCompiler.java:439) org.apache.jasper.compiler.Compiler.compile(Compiler.java:349) org.apache.jasper.compiler.Compiler.compile(Compiler.java:327) org.apache.jasper.compiler.Compiler.compile(Compiler.java:314) org.apache.jasper.JspCompilationContext.compile(JspCompilationContext.java:592) org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServletWrapper.service(JspServletWrapper.java:317) org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServlet.serviceJspFile(JspServlet.java:313) org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServlet.service(JspServlet.java:260) javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:717)note The full stack trace of the root cause is available in the Apache Tomcat/6.0.29 logs.Apache Tomcat/6.0.29 原因：我用maven来管理项目导入的包，使用maven默认的tomcat插件，如下所示，其版本为上面报错信息的最后一行所示即：Apache Tomcat/6.0.29。但是小编使用的是JDK 1.8。tomcat6不支持JDK 1.8，所以发生报错 12345678<plugin> <groupId>org.codehaus.mojo</groupId> <artifactId>tomcat-maven-plugin</artifactId> <version>1.1</version> <configuration> <port>8080</port> </configuration></plugin> 解决办法：将上面的tomcat-maven-plugin,换为如下所示tomcat7-maven-plugin，并以tomcat7:run启动即可。 12345678<plugin> <groupId>org.apache.tomcat.maven</groupId> <artifactId>tomcat7-maven-plugin</artifactId> <version>2.2</version> <configuration> <port>8080</port> </configuration></plugin> 参考链接： http://blog.csdn.net/u011781521/article/details/53713162 http://blog.csdn.net/qtskyll/article/details/73551024 7.在PL/SQL中查询数据库，发现日期中的中文乱码，但是其他字段的中文并没有乱码。解决办法：配置Administrator的用户环境变量NLS_TIMESTAMP_FORMAT YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS:FF6 点击此电脑右键属性，点击高级系统设置，在弹出的窗口中选高级，下面有个环境变量，点击进去，在Administrator的用户变量下点新建，在变量名弹出的窗口中写入，变量名：NLS_TIMESTAMP_FORMAT ，变量值是：YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS:FF6。最后关闭PL/SQL客户端再重启即可。 （小编在帖子里面看到说修改注册表中的NLS_LANG ,这个对日期中的中文乱码并没有什么作用（小编亲测），但是它可以解决开启PL/SQL端时提示的数据库字符集和客户端字符集不一致） 8.解决开启PL/SQL端时提示的数据库字符集和客户端字符集不一致解决办法：按win+R,在弹出的小窗口中输入regedit，然后按回车键，就会跳出来注册表编辑器。按照如下路径计算机\KEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\WOW6432Node\ORACLE\KEY_XE就可以找到oracle的NLS_LANG。点击NLS_LANG右键，选修改，将弹出的窗口中的数值数据改为SIMPLIFIED CHINESE_CHINA.AL32UTF8，它原来的数据是SIMPLIFIED CHINESE_CHINA.ZHS16GBK点击确定即可。

posts.title: 一个手机壳的故事--梵高
posts.slug: share/grocery/一个手机壳的故事--梵高
posts.excerpt: Estrella昨天想要买一个《罗纳河畔的星夜》挂在书桌前。如下图：
posts.text: Estrella昨天想要买一个《罗纳河畔的星夜》挂在书桌前。如下图： 为什么呢？因为感觉需要,第一眼看到它就觉得有一种孤寂感，但是一想对于一个一无所有，还漂在外的人来说好像太矫情啦？还是附上店铺链接。小黄就想啊，有没有手机壳啊，同时解决手机壳和心灵需求，然后万能的淘宝就告诉我啦，这个完全可以有。下面附上小编的纠结三选项《罗纳河畔的星夜》《日出》《奥维尔的绿色麦田》。手机壳版的《罗纳河畔的星夜》只截取了部分，和看整幅的感觉完全不一样啊，最终选择了另外一副我从没见过的《Green Wheat Fields,Auvers》《奥维尔的绿色麦田》。附上店铺链接。为了找出《奥维尔的绿色麦田》来源，大晚上看了快上百张梵高和莫奈各个时期的画做，只为找出画的这幅画的名称以及证实是不是梵高的画，最终得到了结果。原图如下：《奥维尔的绿色麦田》（Green Wheat Fields ,Auvers ）(1890)《奥维尔的绿色麦田》(左下细节)《奥维尔的绿色麦田》(右下细节)《奥维尔的绿色麦田》(左上细节)《奥维尔的绿色麦田》(右上细节)2013年12月20日，梵高遗作《奥维尔的绿色麦田》（Green Wheat Fields ,Auvers )(1890)正式在美国华盛顿国家艺术博物馆西馆M-83画廊展出。梵高生命尽头创作的这幅巨作间隔47年后再度露面，吸引了众多艺术爱好者前往参观。 著名慈善家、收藏家保罗·梅隆（Paul mellon）（1907-1999）将这幅巨作捐赠给华盛顿国家艺术博物馆。 华盛顿国家艺术博物馆馆长厄尔·A·鲍威尔三世（Earl A. Powell III）坦言: “《奥维尔的绿色麦田》这幅创作于奥维尔时期的杰作，将是博物馆梵高作品收藏的一次强有力的补充。由于诸如保罗·梅隆（Paul Mellon ）、艾尔萨·梅隆·布鲁斯（Ailsa Mellon Bruce）、切斯特·戴尔（Chester Dale）、帕梅拉·哈里曼（Pamela Harriman）以及约翰·惠特尼（John Hay Whitney）等慈善家的慷慨捐赠，我们今天才拥有了9件梵高绘画作品，其中6件已相继在博物馆展出。 创作于1890年春季或者初夏的《奥维尔绿色的麦田》是梵高在法国奥维尔的瓦兹村创作而成。梵高在奥维尔、阿尔勒以及圣雷米小镇游览时创作的那些取材于奥维尔教堂、市政厅以及别致茅草屋的作品被人们称作为“纯粹的风景画”。 在《奥维尔绿色的麦田》这幅画中，梵高摒弃了先前的乡村石墙，木制推车，高大树木以及乡村建筑等题材，取而代之的是飘动的云朵以及高耸的绿草。《奥维尔绿色的麦田》三分之二的区域都被绿色和蓝色覆盖，并点缀有金灿灿的黄色花朵，使整幅画都充满了清新柔和的色调。 华盛顿国家艺术博物馆法国绘画策展人玛丽·莫顿（Mary Morton）说道：“《绿色的麦田》这部作品最吸人眼球的是色彩的运用以及画家的创作手法。梵高手中的画刷在画纸上挥动，创作出来的云朵在风的吹动下时而开放时而闭合。《奥维尔绿色的麦田》用厚实涂料制作而成，这也是梵高绘画最显著的特征。通过运用强劲的手法以及鲜明地色彩，梵高将乡村的风景描绘得栩栩如生。” 据悉，《奥维尔的绿色麦田》（Green Wheat Fields ,Auvers )(1890)将和《林中的少女》(Girl in White )(1890)、《橄榄树园》(The Olive Orchard )(1889)、《玫瑰》(Roses )(1890)、《自画像》(Self Portrait )(1889)以及《 La Mousme》 (1888)等梵高作品一起在华盛顿国家艺术博物馆展出。((来源：99ys)) 我觉得我有可能见过这幅画的真迹，毕竟那时候在华盛顿国家艺术博物馆看了很多的画，想想还有点小兴奋呢！对于我这个工科女来说其实是看不懂各种主题特色的画，但是TOEFL里面会谈及很多艺术家艺术史等人文方面的东西，接触越多也就越想了解吧，偶然从学姐那借了一本《小顾聊绘画》，开始认识各种画家和各种艺术风格，还挺好玩的。以前听TED里面说艺术家们创作艺术用来表达人类的情感。我想我看到这些画的时候就是这种感觉，说不上来，它哪里吸引你，但是你知道它不一样。 小编也来科普下梵高各个时期的艺术风格和故事吧！看了看，算了，还是别人整理的比较好，附上链接，一起愉快欣赏吧！http://www.lingganjia.com/view/100131.htm

posts.title: TPO 29 Reading - three passages
posts.excerpt:
TPO 29 - Characteristics of Roman Potterydo justify to 公平评判，公平对待；be backed up by 被…支持；photographs and drawing 照片和图画；tough a 艰苦的，坚韧的；very tough, although, like all pottery, it shatters [ˈʃætə(r)] if dropped on a hard surface非常坚韧，虽然，像许多罐子一样它会破碎，如果落到坚硬的表面；
be made with carefully selected and purified clay 用精选和提纯的黏土；eg: It is generally made with carefully selected and purified clay, worked to thin-walled and standardized shapes on a fast wheel and fired in a kiln (pottery oven) capable of ensuring a consistent finish.work to 根据…行事,致力于；kiln n 窑； a consistent finish 一气呵成；
posts.text: TPO 29 - Characteristics of Roman Potterydo justify to 公平评判，公平对待；be backed up by 被…支持；photographs and drawing 照片和图画；tough a 艰苦的，坚韧的；very tough, although, like all pottery, it shatters [ˈʃætə(r)] if dropped on a hard surface非常坚韧，虽然，像许多罐子一样它会破碎，如果落到坚硬的表面； be made with carefully selected and purified clay 用精选和提纯的黏土；eg: It is generally made with carefully selected and purified clay, worked to thin-walled and standardized shapes on a fast wheel and fired in a kiln (pottery oven) capable of ensuring a consistent finish.work to 根据…行事,致力于；kiln n 窑； a consistent finish 一气呵成；eg: It takes years of hard work to be an excellent interpreter. inevitably [ɪnˈevɪtəbli] ad 必然，必定，免不了；minor [‘maɪnər] a 较次的，轻微的；blemish [‘blemɪʃ] n 瑕疵；flaw [flɔ] n 瑕疵；eg: But what strikes the eye and the touch /most immediately and most powerfully with Roman pottery is its consistent high quality.冲击视觉和触觉（意译为：让人瞠目结舌的是）/ 最直接最有力的stack and store 堆积和存储；eg: they need to be convinced of its true age.人们很难相信它们的真实年龄；eg: As impressive as the quality [‘kwɑləti] of Roman pottery [‘pɑtəri] is its sheer[ʃɪr] massive [‘mæsɪv] quantity.brittle a 硬但易碎的；pleasant a 愉快的，吸引人的；eg: When considering quantities, we would ideally like to have some estimates for overall production from particular sites of pottery manufacture and for overall consumption at specific settlements.当我们考虑质量时，我们会理想化的从陶器生产商的特定地点和特定居民区的整体消耗量来估计整体的产量。eg: Unfortunately, it is in the nature of the archaeological evidence, which is almost invariable 始终如一的，永无变化的 only a sample of what once existed, that such figures will always be elusive难以琢磨的. question the abundance of Roman Pottery质疑罗马陶瓷的丰富度Mediterranean 地中海；eg: This abundance is notable in Roman settlements (especially urban sites) where the labor {that archaeologists have to put into the washing and sorting of potsherds (fragments of pottery) } constitutes a high proportion of the total work during the initial phases of excavation.{…}此处从句用于修饰labor；notable a 显著的；put into 注入,投入；wash and sort 清洗和分类；potshred 陶瓷碎片；a high proportion of 很高比例的；the initial phases of excavation 初步挖掘阶段；derive 导出，追究起源；eg: However, there is one exceptional dump, which does represent a very large part of the site’s total history of consumption and for which an estimate of quantity has been produced.dump 垃圾场；exceptional a 异常的，杰出的；a very large part of the site 大部分地点total history of consumption 总消耗的历史；substantial a 大量的；eg: Around 6,000 million liters of oil were imported into the city from overseas, imports into imperial Rome were supported by the full might of the state and were therefore quite exceptional.由国家全力支持；noetheless n 尽管如此，但是；cannot fail to impress 无法不让人印象深刻lay behind sb/sth 藏在…后面；manufacture high-quality containers 生产高质量的容器；on delivery 交货，演讲；far/farther/further afield 在远方；spot/ site 地方get yourself on a spot of bother让自己遇到麻烦； TPO 29 - Competitionmechanism [‘mekə.nɪzəm] n 机制，方法；be referred to as 被称为，被当做；sth has been long known for sb 某事为sb所熟知；in detail 详细地；in considerable detail 非常详细地；in superabundant suppy 在有余供应中； scarce a 缺乏，不足，稀少；the concern of evolutionary biology 生物进化的关注点；inter- 在…之间，相互；intra- 在…里，在…内；interspecies 不同物种间；intraspecies 同物种内；the size of competing populations 竞争物种数量的大小；indigenous [ɪn’dɪdʒənəs] a 本土的，土生土长的；indigent [‘ɪndɪdʒənt] a 十分贫穷的；competing [kəm’pitɪŋ] 竞争的；eg: No serious competition exists when the major needed resource is in superabundant supply, as in most cases of the coexistence of herbivores (plant eaters).正如多数情况下植食性动物能共存；exterminate = die out = extinct (a)= eliminate 灭绝；a large fraction of 很大一部分；fraction n 分数，少部分，小数；be unable to withstand competition from invading North America species 不能抵挡北美物种入侵的竞争；withstand v 抵住，经受住；isthmus of Panama 巴拿马地峡（连接南北美的）；added predation 增加的捕猎行为；close relative with same demand 有相同需求的近亲；joint a 共同的，联合的；eg: The evolutionary effect of competition on species has been referred to as “species selection”; however, this description is potentially misleading. Only the individuals of a species are subject to the pressures of natural selection. The effect on the well-being and existence of a species is just the result of the effects of selection on all the individuals of the species. Thus species selection is actually a result of individual selection. density-dependent a 密度制约的；dependent a 取决于，依赖的； TPO 29 - The History of Waterpowerfor grinding corn 用来磨玉米；beyond its boundaries 在他的边界外；pass across the blades 经过浆页；kinetic energy 动能；eg: But then steam power entered the scene, putting the whole future of waterpower in doubt.take over 接管，继承；obsolete a [.ɑbsə’lit] 淘汰的；废弃的；过时的；eg: However, like many later experts, this one would have suffered from an inability to see into the future.然而，想许多后期的专家一样，这个理论被指为没有远见；supersede v 取代；full-scale a 全面的，彻底的；on the banks of the Wey River 在渭河河畔；eg: Unfortunately this early plant experienced the problem common to many forms of renewable energy: the flow in the Wey River was unreliable, and the waterwheel was soon replaced by a steam engine.plant n 植物，工厂，发电厂；seldom if ever 绝无仅有，难得；seldom or never 很少，简直不；eg: From this primitive start, the electric industry grew during the final 20 years of the nineteenth century at a rate seldom if ever exceeded by any technology.很少被任何科技超过；eg: The capacity of individual power stations, many of them hydro plants, rose from a few kilowatts to over a megawatt in less than a decade.黑体部分为插入语，看的时候直接跳过，回头再看。megawatt 兆瓦； hydro plants 水电站；ever since 从那时起；

get your work seen in places like restaurants, book stores.come through 胜利；I can see that. 我明白；keep up with trendy 跟上潮流；eg: You wind up creating something that you don’t really believe in.wind up 结束，终止； TPO-16-C2.Reschedule the medieval history testcongratulate you on the class leadership award恭喜你获得班级领导奖；congratulate sb on sth;nominate [‘nɑmɪ.neɪt]提名；take a trip 旅行，去旅行；eg: the thing is the bus leaves right in the middle of when our history class meets this afternoon.eg: I’m giving you several short essay questions 简答题 to make you think critically about the points we’ve discussed in class to state and defend your opinion, analysis the issues, and speculate about how things might have turned out differently.look for updates 查找更新；what i want is for you to synthesize information (合成信息)and reflect back on (反思) what we’ve read and discussed and to form you own idea, not just repeat points from textbook.eg: you are looking for my point of view.你想看下我的观点。 TPO-12-C1.Revise a Hemingway papertangential [tæn’dʒenʃəl]稍微沾边的；离题的；不相干的；正切的distract [dɪ’strækt] 转移（注意力）；分散（思想）；使分心;eg: all that tangential material just distract the main argument.所有不相关的材料都分散了要点。I am really swamped.我已经忙得不可开交了；I’m overwhelmed.我已经忙得不可开交了；我高兴坏了；我不知所措的；我已经彻底被打败了；spring break 春假；it’s your call. 由你决定；eg: but with a little extra effort, you could turn this into a fine essay.eg: I can see how it tries to do too much.我能明白它写多了；historical [hiˈstɒrik(ə)l]历史的，有关历史的；eg: I would just stick to the topic紧扣主题. Anything unrelated to the use of nature imagery [ɪ’mædʒɪ.neri] has no place in the paper.eg: where to draw[drɔ] the line? 何处划限？eg: Better a short well-structured paper than a long paper that’s poorly-structured and wanders off topic(离题).shoot for 力争；切望tell me about it 这还用说；我了解；就是这样；eg: Do you really settle for pretty good 满足于很棒 when you can do something very good? TPO-17-C1.Find materials for an opera papershakespearean [ʃeɪkˈspɪərrɪərn] 莎士比亚的；莎士比亚风格的；classic 一流的，典型的；名著；staging n 演出形式，演出风格；modern[ˈmɒdə(r)n] staging 现代演出风格；straight forward into the point 直接且中肯；straight forward 直截了当；track it down 追踪它；look for it 追踪它；come after it 相继跟着来的；a landmark production 地标性作品；ironic a [aɪ’rɑnɪk]反语的，讽刺的；interpretation n [ɪn.tɜrprə’teɪʃ(ə)n] 解释，说明；because it’s live, when the performance has finished…活的，有生命的，现场直播的；transient a 短暂的；campaign [kæm’peɪn] n 战役，运动； TPO-27-C2.Write a paper about hydroponic farmingirrigation n 灌溉；hydroponic a 水培法的；speacity n 专长，特点；artficial islands 人工岛；build up 建立；in shallow lakes 在浅水湖里；the primary medium 最初的培养基；go with sth 继续…leave out with sth 去掉…look into 深入了解…. TPO-28-C1.Suggestions on paper revisiontwist my ankle 扭伤脚踝；political philosophy 政治哲学；eg: You gave a great biographical sketch in the beginning.你给了一个很好的自传简述（人物生平简介）在文章开头。stretch 延伸；situate his philosophy within the time period 定位他的哲学在时期内；look back up at the section 回看一下这个章节；eg: This is a good content, but you haven’t present the information in a systematic [.sɪstə’mætɪk] way.come later 过会儿来；the thinkings of other intellectuals 其他知识分子的想法，观念；intellectual influence 知识影响力；eg: And their some unnecessary materail getting in the way.一些不必要的材料干扰了主题；get in the way 妨碍；a copy of department’s document on the correct format for index(目录), citations(引文), references(参考文献) political science department 政治系，政治科学系；help out 帮助…摆脱困境，求助； TPO-32-C1.The bookstore’s buyback policieson the buyback list 在重新买回的书单里；put the list together 收集书单；eg: i checked earlier and i know she hasn’t gotten back to us on that class yet.updated edition[ɪ’dɪʃ(ə)n] 更新的版本；eg: Usually if an updated edition is available [ə’veɪləb(ə)l], professors will go for that one.something [‘sʌmθɪŋ] （注意重音部分）某事；get something back 取回；another [ə’nʌðər] 另一个；wholesaler n 批发商；distribute v 分配；eg: because used books show wear and tear, you know, water stains, scruffy covers and yellow highlighting.scruffy 脏乱的； stain 污迹；wear and tear 磨损；text n 教科书，文本；end up on the buyback list 最终在回购的书里面；beat-up a 破旧的； TPO-34-C2.Discuss Welty’s writing stylesubject matter 主题；take away 带回去的，带走；eg: Did you have the chance to read the story? 你已经看过这个故事了吗？eg: as the due date of your story approaches当你故事的截止日期要到时；

posts.text: Words and Phrases sewer [ˈsuər] 下水道； strike fear into sb 使…感到害怕； pet [pet] 宠物，宝贝，红人； strike [straɪk] 罢工，攻击，打；(用炫迈口香糖来记住这个读音) find their way into 出现在… eg: Rivers find their way into the sea. have been around 已经存在； taught [tɔ:t] 教授； observe the rules 遵守规则； observe 观察，注意到； pass on = pass away sth 传递，通过； pass sth along to sb 传递； nothing new 不是什么新鲜事； copy/ replicate replicator [‘replɪkeɪtər] 复制机； property 属性，财富； property and characteristics 性质和特征； for one reason or another; reproduce in large numbers; housefly 家蝇； genetic mutation 基因突变； Structureeg: Where am I going with this? 我的用意是什么呢？ eg: Well, the whole point of defining this familiar process as transmission of memes is so that we can explore its analogy with the transmission of genes. eg: We know fidelity is an essential principle of genetic transmission. 我们知道准确性是基因传递的一个重要的原则。(卡几嘛，好深奥啊) eg: If you change a word, the others will usually bring you in line. 如果你改变了个词，其他的人通常会把你带回线上。 eg: That’s not how you sing it. 这不是你这样唱的。 eg: .So, you can see how looking at pieces of cultural information as replicators, as memes, and analyzing them in terms of longevity, fecundity and fidelity, we can gain some inside about how they spread, persist or change. Structure用Alligator& twinkle star的例子引出mems，然后将memes和gene分别定义然后analogy，分3点longevity, fecundity, fidelity来说明memes的key characteristics。

posts.title: TPO29-R2.Competition
posts.excerpt:
Analysis for errorQ8 Paragraph 3 supports the idea that Gause’s experiments were important because they

A
provided a situation in which competition could be removed from the interaction between two species

B
showed that previous ideas about the extent to which competition determines the composition of a community were completely mistaken

C
helped establish that competition will remove all but one species from any given ecological niche

D
offered evidence that competition between species is minimal when there is an overabundance of a single food source
posts.text: Analysis for errorQ8 Paragraph 3 supports the idea that Gause’s experiments were important because they A provided a situation in which competition could be removed from the interaction between two species B showed that previous ideas about the extent to which competition determines the composition of a community were completely mistaken C helped establish that competition will remove all but one species from any given ecological niche D offered evidence that competition between species is minimal when there is an overabundance of a single food source 选错两次B,D，正确答案C 错误原因： 第一次错：省题时迫于时间压力，没有仔细看题，故将此题误判为目的题，在例子前面找答案，但是又看不懂的句子，就选了一个含有最多和原文相近内容的句子。 第二次错：知道不是目的题，但是还是看不懂文章首句和C选项的意思，故选了一个含有 a single food source的选项。 解决办法： 分析原文 To what extent [competition determines (the composition of a community and the density of particular species)] has been the source of considerable controversy. The problem is that competition ordinarily cannot be observed directly but must be inferred from the spread or increase of one species and the concurrent reduction or disappearance of another species. The Russian biologist G. F. Gause performed numerous tow-species experiments in the laboratory, in which one of the species became extinct when only a single kind of resource was available. On the basis of these experiments and of field observations, the so-called law of competitive exclusion was formulated, according to which no two species can occupy the same niche. Numerous seeming exceptions to this law have since been found, but they can usually be explained as cases in which the two species, even though competing for a major joint resource, did not really occupy exactly the same niche. to what extent 在多大程度上； the source of …的原因； considerable controversy 相当多的争议； be inferred from 由…推断； concurrent reduction or disappearance of another species 同时减少或者消失的另一个物种； Russian 俄罗斯人，俄罗斯的； tow-species 两个物种的； On the basis of these experiments and of field observations, the so-called law of competitive exclusion was formulated, according to which no two species can occupy the same niche. law of competitive exclusion 竞争排除法则； formulate 表达，用简洁的语言描述，用公式表达(简记为表达)； 发现分析完原文还是不知道C选项和原文有什么关联，那就看目的词provided a situation，showed，helped establish，offered evidence，由 On the basis of these experiments and of field observations, the so-called law of competitive exclusion was formulated, according to which no two species can occupy the same niche.可知是在前个实验的基础上，formulated一个law。所以是establish。 Q9Which of the sentences below best expresses the essential information in the highlighted sentence in the passage? Incorrect choices change the meaning in important ways or leave out essential information. A Apparent exceptions to this law usually involves cases in which two species compete for the same major resource but occupy slightly different niches. B Although it may appear that two species always have different niches, many exceptions show that species compete with each other. C Cases in which two species not only compete for a shared resource but also occupy similar niches are considered exceptions to this law. D Cases in which the two species do not occupy that same niche yet still compete for the same resource are believed to be exceptions to this law. 错选两次，两次同选D。 错误原因： D项翻译：例子：不占用相同小生态的两个物种却仍然竞争相同的资源被认为是这个法则的特例。觉得和原文翻译能对照，殊不知，seeming是表面上的意思，所以我连错两次，所以知道反向形容词有哪些是有多么的重要啊！ apparent 明显的，表面上的； 原文Numerous seeming exceptions to this law have since been found, but they can usually be explained as cases in which the two species, even though competing for a major joint resource, did not really occupy exactly the same niche. 对这个法则来说无数表面上的特例被发现，但是他们通常被解释为两个物种的例子，即使竞争一个主要的共同的资源，也不会真的占用两个相同的小生态。 Q10According to paragraph 4, how does competition affect evolution? A It results in the evolution of physical structures that allow the species to compete with each other more effectively. B It results I the evolutionary extinction of all but one of the competing species. C It results in the competing species evolving in such a way that they no longer compete for the same resources. D It results in the competing species evolving to become so much like each other that competition between them eventually disappears. 选错两次，同选A 错误原因： 翻译A选项：生物结构进化的结果允许物种间能够更有效的竞争。 看原文 Competition among species is of considerable evolutionary importance. The physical structure of species competing for resources in the same ecological niche tends to gradually evolve in ways that allow them to occupy different niches. Competing species also tend to change their ranges so that their territories no longer overlap. The evolutionary effect of competition on species has been referred to as “species selection”; however, this description is potentially misleading. Only the individuals of a species are subject to the pressures of natural selection. The effect on the well-being and existence of a species is just the result of the effects of selection on all the individuals of the species. Thus species selection is actually a result of individual selection. 强点部分翻译：在相同生态小环境中竞争资源的物种的身体结构倾向于逐渐进化成一种方式，这就是允许它们去占领不同的小生态。竞争的物种也倾向于去改变它们的范围，为了让它们的领域不再重叠，竞争进化对物种的影响被指为物种选择。 14C Investigation of the ecological role of competition is difficult because ordinarily the competition cannot be observed directly and must be inferred from its presumed effects. E Competition between a pair of species tends to lessen over time because the species tend to evolve to occupy different ecological niches and ranges. 选C没选E C项翻译，竞争的生态角色的研究是困难的因为通常竞争不能被直接的观察，必须从可能的影响中推断。 原文是： The problem is that competition ordinarily cannot be observed directly but must be inferred from the spread or increase of one species and the concurrent reduction or disappearance of another species. 问题是竞争通常不能直接被观察但是必须从一个物种的扩散和增加和同时一个物种的减少和消失中推测 原文和选项同义改写：原文是已知影响，推测原因；选项是竞争要从可能的影响中被推测。然而不选的原因是它是个细节。想强调的应该是生物学的那个实验，以及由实验得出的结论。 E项翻译，一对物种之间的竞争倾向于减少，随着时间的流逝，因为物种倾向于进化成占领不同的小生态和范围。 这个点事第4段的主要内容，但是我由于没看懂第四段，故没有选择此选项。算算第四段没看懂错了三题，天哪。

posts.title: TPO29-R2.Prerequisites for a film theory course
posts.slug: TOEFL/TPO5-C2.Prerequisites for a film theory course
posts.excerpt:
Words and Phrases as prerequisite [pri’rekwəzɪt] 作为先决条件；
drop back 回到原点；
drop it now 现在放下/ 放弃；
frankly 坦率地，直率地；
in-depth 彻底的，深入详尽的；
catch up 跟上，赶上；
posts.text: Words and Phrases as prerequisite [pri’rekwəzɪt] 作为先决条件； drop back 回到原点； drop it now 现在放下/ 放弃； frankly 坦率地，直率地； in-depth 彻底的，深入详尽的； catch up 跟上，赶上； Sentencepretty much everyone else 差不多每个人；get 明白； eg: It seems that pretty much everyone else in the class gets what they are supposed to be doing but I’m not so sure. 似乎班上的每个人都知道他们要做什么，但是我不确定。 eg: Well, the class is for students who are really serious about film. 这个课程是针对认真对待电影的学生而开的。 eg: Did you concentrate mainly on form or content? 你们过去主要关注形式还是内容？ eg: we have two introductory courses that are supposed to be taken before you get to my course, one in film art, techniques, technical stuff and another in film history. get to my course 接触我的课程； techniques 方法，技能； technical stuff 技术细节； eg: Students in the class (you are in) should be pretty far along in film studies. 你所在课堂的学生应该在电影研究上很有造诣了。 eg: In fact, usually the system blocks anyone (trying to sign up for a class for they shouldn’t be taking). 事实上，系统经常阻止每个不应该上这门课的学生注册这门课。 eg: For your own good, I really suggest you dropping back and starting at the usual place. eg: Like any other professional training we build on previous knowledge. 像其他任何的专业训练一样，我们建立在前人的知识上。 eg: Maybe you can recommend some extra reading that I can do to catch up. eg: Well, are you intending to study film as your main concentration? eg: There is no harm in try to keep up with this class. eg: We have them on video. 我们拥有他们的视频。 eg: It’s still a pretty tall order, and we will be moving right along, So you will really need to stay on top of it . a tall [tɔl] order 高要求；right along 不停地，不断地；stay on top of it 坚持住； eg: OK, I’ve been warned. 好的，我收到警告了。 eg: That would give you a better handle on the subject. 这样做，你会更好的掌握这门课。 Structure学生提出问题，教授询问学生的学习情况，并给出建议，建议未被完全接纳，转换另一种建议，对话结束。 Editor’s message既然conversation谈到了film，所以小编就在封面放了一张《心灵捕手》的海报，小编也是好友推荐的，看完有所思。感觉很好，有兴趣你们也可以看下。

posts.title: TPO5-C1.Adjustment to life at university
posts.excerpt:
Words and Phrases a counselor [‘kaʊnsələr]  一个咨询师/ 指导老师；
at the university counseling center 在大学咨询中心；
on a big campus;
in an unfamiliar city;
counsel [‘kaʊns(ə)l] 律师，法律顾问；

eg: I’m a little overwhelmed by the size of this place.

posts.text: Words and Phrases a counselor [‘kaʊnsələr] 一个咨询师/ 指导老师； at the university counseling center 在大学咨询中心； on a big campus; in an unfamiliar city; counsel [‘kaʊns(ə)l] 律师，法律顾问； council [‘kaʊns(ə)l] 市政服务机构； problem [‘prɑbləm] 问题；(我竟然连这个音都是读的错了，那些年都干了啥的) no problem overwhelm [.oʊvər’hwelm] 压倒，制服，推翻； overwhelmed a 不知所措的； eg: I’m a little overwhelmed by the size of this place. everyone know everyone 每个人都相互认识； culture [‘kʌltʃər] 文化(读了这么多年，这个单词发音也是错的)； a bit of a culture shock 一点儿文化冲击； that’s an understatement. 不止这些/ 这是一个保守的说法； you know, socially 你知道的，社交上的问题。 in the huge lecture halls 在大的讲堂里面； have trouble (in) doing sth 做某事有困难； raise my hand keep my hand up that wouldn’t seem right. 这种方法似乎不妥。 pop in 突然到访； eg: There is no reason you couldn’t pop in to hi and to make yourself known. stop by 顺便到访； artsy a 附庸风雅的，似乎爱好艺术的； string quartet [kwɔr’tet] 弦乐四重奏；（弦乐四重奏是一种音乐演奏形式，或是说一种音乐作品，由4把弦乐器负责，通常是2把小提琴，一把中提琴和一把大提琴。 quarter 四分之一； search high and low for a replacement [rɪˈpleɪsmənt] 上下寻觅一个替代的人； Sentenceeg: Thanks for seeing me on such short notice. 谢谢您能见我，通知的很临时，抱歉。 on such short notice 刚约就要见面； eg: Well, I think I might have made a mistake coming to the school. eg: In either case, I wouldn’t take it personally. 不管怎么说，我个人不认同你说的。 eg: but why not stop by his office during office hours? eg: Taking time from other students who need help. 占用其他需要帮助的学生的时间。 eg: Have you been playing long? 你弹奏的时间久吗？ eg: since age ten 十岁的时候开始。 would you be interested in auditioning? 你有兴趣去面试一下吗？ audition (招收演员时的)试听； audience 观众； eg: I wanted to get my academic work settled before pursuing my music here. Structure首先从小镇来到陌生城市对校园生活的不适，提出主要在class和dorm上，counselor一一给出建议的解决方案。 Editor’s message这个帖子的顶部的音乐为卡农的四重奏，string quartet ，小编觉得很好听而且在lecture中讨论了一会，所以就找了一个自己喜欢的卡农放进去了，再附赠一个四重奏视频链接，是同一首，但是小编觉得视频的更好听，希望你也会喜欢。

posts.text: Words and Prases literature [‘lɪt(ə)rə.tʃʊr] 文学； genre [‘ʒɑnrə] 类型； start out 开始，出发； characterize [‘kerəktə.raɪz] 描述；是…的特征；以…为典型；使…具有特点（或最引人注目的特征） teller n 讲故事的人； communal [kə’mjun(ə)l] a 共享的，不同群体的； community 社区； constant a 不变的；重复的； thread [θred] 思路，线程； hold together 团结在一起； that was the thread that held the tale together. 这是故事团结在一起的思路；意译为，为情节穿针引线； modify [‘mɑdɪ.faɪ] 修改，调节； mode [moʊd] 模式，风格； audience [ˈɔːdiəns] 观众； improbable [ɪm’prɑbəb(ə)l] adj. 不大可能真实的（或发生的）；不大可能的；奇异的；荒谬的 impossible a 不可能的； royalty n 皇室； line-up 节目安排； Once upon a time 很久以前 (终于不用再说long long ago ) in a faraway [.fɑrə’weɪ] land 在一个遥远的地方； specify [‘spesɪ.faɪ] 具体说明； come back to this point in a few minutes authoritative a 权威的； be tailored to sb 为…定做； pass down orally within cultures generation to generation 在某一文化领域内口口相传； have a slightly different version of the same folk tale be tailored to suit a particular audience Sentenceeg: Now we can’t really talk about fairy tales(童话故事) without first talking about folk tales(民间故事) because there’s a strong connection between these two genres, these two types of stories. fairy 美丽的；优雅的；妖精(一样)的；仙女似的； eg: a frog [frɒɡ] turning into a prince[prɪns] ; princess n 公主； eg: So what’s the folk tale? How would you characterize(描述) them, Jeff? eg: A number of things happen when an oral tale gets written down. 当口头的故事被写下来的时候会发生大量的改变。 Editor’s message小编看到童话和民谣以为要讲故事了，立马就跳过前面的五篇，跑过去听，然而没有故事，不过又长见识了。最后小编附上小时候常听的故事《大灰狼与小红帽》

posts.title: TPO4-L2.Emerson's Self-reliance
posts.excerpt:
Words and Phrases poem  [‘poʊəm] 诗；
Self-Reliance 自力更生；
all sorts of profound questions 各种深奥的问题；
profound a 巨大的；深切的；深远的；知识渊博的;
philosophy  [fɪ’lɑsəfi]  哲学(哲学理念)；
Truth is found within ourselves 真理存在于我们自身；
tie (that) in 结合成一体；
genius [‘dʒiniəs] 天才；
dismiss 解雇，开除；
 have a glimpse of this truth 瞥一眼真相；
be into 喜欢；
posts.text: Words and Phrases poem [‘poʊəm] 诗； Self-Reliance 自力更生； all sorts of profound questions 各种深奥的问题； profound a 巨大的；深切的；深远的；知识渊博的; philosophy [fɪ’lɑsəfi] 哲学(哲学理念)； Truth is found within ourselves 真理存在于我们自身； tie (that) in 结合成一体； genius [‘dʒiniəs] 天才； dismiss 解雇，开除； have a glimpse of this truth 瞥一眼真相； be into 喜欢； the thought or conviction that’s true for you 对你来说真实的想法和信念； believe in yourself 相信你自己； drive home 讲清楚； drive home the meaning of this new word 讲清楚这个新单词的意思； drive this argument home throughout this essay 通过这篇文章讲清楚了他的论点； a novel idea 这是一个新颖的想法； be less secure about about sth 对某事不很有把握； takes this step further 进一步阐明这一点； not confirming yourself or your post 不屈服于你自己或你的过去； the famous bits of this essay 这篇文章最重要的点； make up of 组成； attest to that 证实这点； take some pretty interesting turns 带给我一些特别有趣的转折； trust your own talent 相信你自己的天赋； post [poʊst] path [pæθ] sentenceseg: All right, so let me close today’s class with some thoughts to keep in mind while you are doing tonight’s assignment. eg: I think this essay has the potential to be quite meaningful for all of you as young people who probably wonder about things like truth and where your lives are going - all sorts of profound questions. eg: Knowing something about Emerson’s philosophies will help you when you read “Self-Reliance“. eg: So this truth, the idea that it’s in each one of us, is one of the first points that you’ll see Emerson making in this essay. 真理，我们每个人都有的想法； eg: So Emerson is really into each individual believing in and trusting him or herself. 真的喜欢；相信并且信任； eg: He criticizes that people of his time for abandoning their own times and their own wills for the sake of conformity and consistency. eg: They try to fit in with the rest of the world even though it’s at odds with their beliefs and their identities. eg: The country as a whole was trying to define itself. 这个国家作为一个整体都在试图定义自己； eg: So that’s something that I think is definitely as relevant today as it was then, probably, um, especially among young adults like yourselves, you know, uh, college being a time to sort of really think about who you are and where you’re going. 过去和今天一样相关； eg: Up close, it seems a little all over the place, but from farther away, the true path shows and in the end it justifies all the turns along the way. 就近来看曲折到处都是，但是就远来看，真正的道路显现出来之后，在结尾证明多有的曲折都是正确的； eg: So, don’t worry if you are not sure where you’re headed or what your long-term goals are. Stay true to yourself and it’ll make sense in the end. Structuremeaning of self-reliance—philosophy—be into& criticize—his time—not conformity meaning(1&2) Abstract of Self-Reliance 不久前有一天，我读了一位杰出的画家写的几首诗，它们立意新奇，不落窠臼。先别管诗的题材如何，灵魂总是从字里行间听到一种告诫。这些诗句所灌输的情感比它们包含的任何思想更有价值。相信你自己的思想，相信你内心深处认为对你适用的东西对一切人都适用——这就是天才。如果把你隐藏的信念说出来，它一定会成为普遍的感受；因为最内在的在适当的时候就变成了最外在的——我们最初的思想会被“最后的审判”的号角吹送到我们耳边。心灵的声音尽管每个人都非常熟悉，但是我们认为摩西、柏拉图和弥尔顿的最大功绩就在于他们蔑视书本和传统，不是自己想到的东西不说。一个人应当学会发现和观察从内部闪过他心灵的微光，而不是诗人和圣贤的天空里的光彩。可是他擅自摒弃了自己的思想，就因为这是他自己的东西。在天才的每一部作品中，我们认出了我们自己抛弃了的思想：它们带着某种疏远的威严回到了我们的身边。伟大的艺术作品对我们的教益不过如此而已。它们教导我们：正当对方呼声最高的时候，要心平气和、坚定不移地坚持我们自发的感想。要不，到了明天，一位陌生人将会非常高明地说出恰恰是我们一直想到和感到的东西，我们将被迫从别人那里取回我们自己的见解，并羞愧难当。 每个人在求知期间，有一天会得出这样一种信念：嫉妒等于无知；模仿无异于自杀；一个人不管好坏，必须把自己看做自己的命运；虽然广阔的宇宙不乏善举，可是若不在自己得到的那块土地上辛勤耕耘，一粒富有营养的粮食也不会自行送上门来。蕴藏在他身上的力量实际上非常新奇，因此除他之外，谁也不知道他有什么本领，而且不经过尝试，连他自己也不知道。一张面孔、一个人物、一件事实，给他留下了深刻的印象，给另一个人却没有留下任何印象，这不是平白无故的。记忆中的这种雕刻不能不说没有前定的和谐。眼睛被安置在一道光线应当照到的地方，这样它才可以看到那道光线。我们还不能充分表现自己，而且对我们各自所代表的那种神圣的观念感到惭愧。完全可以认为，这种观念非常适当，一定会产生良好的结果。因此应当忠实地传达，不过上帝是不愿意让懦夫来阐明他的功业的。一个人只有尽心竭力地工作，方能感到宽慰和欢乐；如果他说的或做的并非如此，他将得不到安宁。那是一种没有解脱的解脱。还在尝试之中，他的天才就抛弃了他；没有灵感眷顾；没有发明；没有希望。 信赖你自己吧：每一颗心都随着那根铁弦颤动，接受神圣的天意给你安排的位置。接受你同时代的人构成的社会，接受 …… Editor’s message图片是莎翁，不是Emerson； the picture on the top is Shakespeare, not Emerson, because I did not catch episode of the lecture and I chose the wrong answer about Shakespeare. In order to remember this point, I find his portrait.

posts.text: Words and Phrasesleave long trail behind them 在它们后面留下长长的痕迹； tracks 轨道，轨迹； trail 轨迹； theory [‘θiəri] 理论，原理，学说； theorize [‘θiə.raɪz] v 建立理论； windstorm 风暴； wind combine with rain 风雨交加； desert [ˈdezərt] 沙漠； clay [kleɪ] 黏土； dry [draɪ] 干燥的； occasional rain 偶尔的雨； extremely slippery 特别的滑； flooded[‘flʌdəd] 淹没的； an area of desert with water rock becoming embedded in ice 岩石被冰包裹着； take separate routes 走不同的路线； vibrate [‘vaɪ.breɪt] 振动； sensitive [‘sensətɪv] 体贴的，体恤的； lead back to my main point 倒回了我的主要观点； address geology from a wider perspective； carry out carefully 小心的展开 Sentenceseg: So I’ll just touch[tʌtʃ] on an interesting subject that I think it makes an important point. touch on 提及，说到； subject issue assignment theme eg: We’ve been covering rocks and different types of rocks for the last several weeks. eg: To get started(首先) I thought I’d mention(我向我提到过) something that shows how uh… as a geologist, you need to know about more than just rocks and the structure of solid matter(固体). eg: It’s quite a mystery[‘mɪst(ə)ri] . eg: There are no footprints(脚印), no tyre[‘taɪr] tracks(车轮轨迹) and no heavy machinery like a bulldozer[‘bʊl.doʊzər] (推土机)… uh, nothing was ever brought in(引进) to move these heavy rocks. dozer 推土机； eg: Most of the rocks move in the same direction as the dominant wind pattern from southwest to northeast. eg: It’s possible that rain on the desert floor could turn to thin sheets [ʃit] of ice when temperatures drop at night. eg: Could a piece of ice with rocks in it be pushed around by the wind? push around 摆布，驱使； eg: But sadly all these ideas have been eliminated [ɪˈlɪməˌnet] as possibilities. eg: Thing is this is a protective wilderness area. 问题是这是一个受保护的原始地带； eg: I guess that’s all for today. 那么今天讲到这吧。

posts.text: Words and Phrasesthe United States Supreme[sʊ’prim] Court [kɔːt] Decisions[dɪ’sɪʒ(ə)n] 美国最高法院的决策； sit back 不活动，袖手旁观； fair share of the work 合适份量的工作； do their fair share of the work 做他们份内的工作； kind of stressing me out 我有些压力过大； the good old free rider problem 一个典型的free rider的老问题； take credit for things 因某事拿到学分； split up the research into 3 parts 把调查分为3部分； be supposed to 要…; 被期望做…; risk the project going down to the drain(下水道) 冒险让项目流失； start from scratch 从零开始； Got to run 得走了； Sentenceseg: what’s your group doing again? 你们小组又做了什么？ eg: We are looking at the impact of recent cases on property [‘prɑpərti] rights, municipal [mju’nɪsɪp(ə)l] land use cases, owning disputes. 我们正在看最近案件对财产权，市政土地使用权和所有权争端的影响。 eg: Free rider is just a term that describes this situation, when people in the group seek to get the benefits of being in a group without contributing to the work. eg: I mean, they’ve been filing the weekly progress reports with me. file [faɪl] v 提交； eg: I went off to the stack and found some really good material for my part, but when I got back to our table, they were just goofing off and talking. go off to the stack 去书架； goof off 工作吊儿郎当； eg: I had both of them on other courses. 在其他课上教过他们

posts.title: TPO4-L1
posts.excerpt:
Words and Phrasesin the middle of a mating ritual 在交配的过程中；
stop and preen 停下来，然后整理羽毛；
preen [prin]  刻意打扮，整理羽毛；
take a few moments to straighten its feathers 花几分钟时间弄直他的羽毛；

posts.text: Words and Phrasesin the middle of a mating ritual 在交配的过程中； stop and preen 停下来，然后整理羽毛； preen [prin] 刻意打扮，整理羽毛； take a few moments to straighten its feathers 花几分钟时间弄直他的羽毛； feather [‘feðər] 羽毛； return to the mating ritual 返回交配； completely out of place 完全不合适地； a displacement activity 一个替代行为； engage in 参与，忙于； have conflicting drives 有冲突驱动； groom itself 整理自己； groom 培养，擦洗，马夫；preen an irrelevant behavior 一个无关紧要的行为； redirect 转向； two conflicting drives 两种矛盾的冲突； two competing urges 两种竞争性的冲动； in an attack-escape conflict 在攻击和逃跑的冲突中； Sentenceseg: If we take our example from a minute ago, if the bird is afraid of its mate, it’s conflicted. run away 逃走； eg: How about an animal that, um, instead of fighting its enemy[‘enəmi] or running away, it attacks a plant or a bush? (can you imagine that people have this kind of cute behaviors? amazing, really interesting!) eg: It’s appropriate under the circumstances. eg: And the animal, it was conflicted between confronting(对抗) the object and eating the food, so instead, it just fell asleep. (Oh my god ,how cut the animals are, if this scene is animated, that would attract so many audiences, As long as I thought of this picture, I would laugh) eg: And what happens is, they inhibit(抑制) each other, they cancel each other out(抵消两者) in a way, and a third seemingly irrelevant behavior surfaces through a process that we call “Disinhibition [ˌdɪsɪnhɪ’bɪʃ(ə)n] (解除抑制)”. eg: I mean if a bird’s feathers get ruffled or an animal’s fur, maybe it’s not so strange for them to stop and tidy themselves up at that point.

posts.title: TPO30-C2
posts.excerpt:
Words and Phrasesthat’s the thing. 问题就在这。(否定回答，相当于不)
we’re getting close to the deadline. 截止期就要到了。
the theme of night in the paintings of Vincent Van Gogh
high resolution 高分辨率；wallpaper 壁纸；
Van Gogh as an artist of nocturnal[nɑk’tɜrn(ə)l]  themes(夜色主题)
posts.text: Words and Phrasesthat’s the thing. 问题就在这。(否定回答，相当于不) we’re getting close to the deadline. 截止期就要到了。 the theme of night in the paintings of Vincent Van Gogh high resolution 高分辨率；wallpaper 壁纸； Van Gogh as an artist of nocturnal[nɑk’tɜrn(ə)l] themes(夜色主题) intense light 强烈的光； exactly lack [læk] brightness 缺乏亮度； a nighttime scene 一个夜间场景； daytime/ night paintings focus mostly on his painting Starry Night 更关注他的画作《星夜》； part of the permanent collection 永久收藏的部分； it’s the inspiration[.ɪnspə’reɪʃ(ə)n] for Van Gogh’s painting. not out on loan 没有借出； most striking shared feature 最引人瞩目的特点； hold a rattle[‘ræt(ə)l] 拿着一个拨浪鼓； Sentenceseg: That’s the paradox that I really like. eg: But it’s on loan(出借) right now to a museum in Europe. eg: I see. Well, I am strict about having students write about paintings they can observe firsthand(直接地，directly). have sb do sth / let sb do / make sb do 让某人做某事； be strict about doing sth 对…严格要求;坚持…； eg: I made sure it’s not out on loan. eg: Van Gogh copied many Millet’s compositions. (原来有这样，毕竟Millet，附赠Millet’s starry night一张 在yale的艺术馆里面找到的，非常高清，很真实，非常喜欢，名校资源这么好，喜欢艺术的同学们，再附赠连接一个耶鲁艺术馆,网站页面也好看) eg: Although Millet was a realist painter, and Van Gogh a post-impressionist, the two paintings still share lots of features(有很多相同的特点), not just the name. eg: The attributes chosen to be included in a particular miniature was often meant to communicate(传达，也有交流的意思) parents’ hopes and dreams for their child.(有复合句的时候就很难听懂了) eg: So I think you’ll learn a lot about how people viewed children at the time the miniature paintings were done. #Structure 笔记部分画出出题点 #Learning tips 1 反复听真的可以把不熟悉的长句听懂，10遍不行就20遍，继续加油； 2 开始用笔记分析回顾conversation； #Editor’s message 一点一点进步 附赠 cafe terrace at night

posts.text: Words and phrasestheatre [‘θiətər] 戏剧； progress in any sort of logical manner neither [‘niːðə(r)] 两者都不，也不； Sentenceseg: The critiques really tore the play to pieces when it opened. 当他公开的时候，评论将这个戏剧批得体无完肤。 tear 撕扯 tore； eg: Really? Is that a big deal? 真的吗？这有什么大不了的？ eg: Of course the critics’ reaction made some people kind of curious about it. make sb/sth kind of curious about sth(后面的形容词可以加修饰词并且接结构 以前接触多的是make sb adj，有趣) eg: They wanted to see what was causing all the fuss[fʌs](大惊小怪). eg: Well, we have copies of old newspapers in the basement, and all the major papers publish reference guides(索引) to their articles, reviews, etc. eg: You will find them in the reference stacks(参考书堆) in the back. eg: I’m sure there is a tape [teɪp] of the play in our video library. posts.title: TPO30-R2
posts.excerpt:
Words and Phrasesenliven 使快活；使生动；使活跃；
in small increments 以小的增量；
innumerable= countless 无数的，很多的;
sb challenged conventional wisdom with an opposing viewpoint
posts.text: Words and Phrasesenliven 使快活；使生动；使活跃； in small increments 以小的增量； innumerable= countless 无数的，很多的; sb challenged conventional wisdom with an opposing viewpoint a curious feature of the fossil record 一个化石记录奇怪的现象； be at odds with sth (Darwin’s model of continuous change)与–不和，使–处于不利的条件,与–相矛盾； intermediated fossil forms 中间的化石形态； meditate [‘medɪ.teɪt] 沉思，冥想； form n 形态，表格；v 建立，组成； intermediated 中间的，中等的，中级的，适合中间程度者的； persist v 坚持，继续存在； insist v 坚持，固执己见； assist v 协助，促进； persist essentially unchanged 坚持本质不变； precede 先于； jerky 忽动忽停的；uneven 不均匀的； conceive 想象； be turned around 转向，使转好的方向转变；turnaround 延时； come to light 显露； offer a detailed glimpse into sth during periods of environmental stability/ stress Sentenceseg: By the early twentieth century, the question about the rate of evolution had been answered in favor of gradualism to most biologists’ satisfaction. eg: Such changes are all but invisible over the short time scale of modern observations, and, it is argued, they are usually obscured by innumerable gaps in the imperfect fossil record. 普遍但是不可见的；在现代观察的短时间规模内；掩盖； eg: Gradualism, with its stress on the slow pace of change, is a comforting position(立场), repeated over and over again in generations of(几代人的)textbooks. eg: Sometimes a closed question must be reopened as new evidence or new arguments based on old evidence come to light(显露). eg: In 1972 paleontologist(古生物学家) Stephen Jay Gould and Niles Eldredge challenged conventional wisdom(智慧，学问) with an opposing viewpoint, the punctuated(间断的) equilibrium hypothesis, which posits(断言，放置assert, affirm, declare) that species give rise to(导致) new species in relatively sudden bursts, without a lengthy transition period. eg: These episodes of rapid evolution are separated by relatively long static spans(time intervals) during which a species may hardly change at all. 快速进化的时期被相当长的静态周期分隔开，在这段时期物种几乎不改变。 eg: Intermediated (中间的)fossil forms(形态，方式，格式), predicted by gradualism, are typically(往往，常常，典型的) lacking. eg: If evolution had been a continuous, gradual process, one might expect that almost every fossil specimen would be slightly different from every year. eg: If it seems difficult to conceive(想象) how(怎样) major changes could occur rapidly, consider this: an alteration of a single gene in files(in records) is enough to turn a normal fly with a single pair of wings into one that has two pairs of wings. (喜欢，这个句型，同义词代换的好，句型又有变化) Topic sentence recent studies of evolution (punctuated or gradual) Structurethe concept of the gradualism—punctuated equilibrium hypothesis—P example(clam and coral)— new evidence based on the old(horses)—understand above example—question—gradualism example—the connection of hypothesis 首先介绍进化渐进论的概念； 再提出与它相对的概念-间断平衡说； 再给出具体的例子来说明和用以前的例子来说明； 然后提出这两者之间的联系的疑问，到底是哪个； 然后提到渐进主义研究的例子； 最后做出假设以及要继续进行上述exhaustive研究； 文章结构：分总。 有种先说区别，最后一句总说归类 Exercises HIGHLIGHTED SENTENCE In 1972 paleontologist Stephen Jay Gould and Niles Eldredge challenged conventional wisdom with an opposing viewpoint, the punctuated equilibrium hypothesis, which posits that species give rise to new species in relatively sudden bursts, without a lengthy transition period. A The punctuated equilibrium hypothesis challenged gradualism, which holds that species evolve in relatively sudden bursts of brief duration. 在看原文的时候，脑海里自然的想法就把间断平衡假说和突然改变联系在一起了，然后就觉得A,B都对，然而，这里出现了个迷路的which，这题ETS考的是语法，我晕，根据就近原则，which 是gradualism的从句。 B The punctuate equilibrium hypothesis, in opposition to gradualism, holds that transitions from one species to another occur in comparatively sudden burst. C In 1972 Stephen Jay Gould and Niles Eldredge challenged gradualism by positing that change from one species to another cannot occur without a lengthy transition period. 这题，我的bug在于忽略了负负得正，not without = with，发现自己经常根据先入为主的印象判断问题，不能客观公正的看待题目的句子，这个区别和联系还是要注意。 According to paragraph 3, the lack of intermediate fossils in the fossil record of some species A has been extensively studied by paleontologist for over a century(他们只是很熟悉那些化石但是并没有研究，而且通常都被忽视) B contradicts the idea that most species have remained unchanged for millions of years(我的错误选项就是这个，后面的most species没有问题，但是它不是contradict，而是支持化石可能没改变，这个目的题还是要看题目的啊，加上出现原文的内容，所以我又自然对它有亲切感，但它并不是个好答案wake up) C challenges the view that evolutionary change is gradual(例证挑战的都是以前的观点，老观点，支持现在的观点) D is most common in the fossil records of clam and coral species (虽说以clam和coral为例，但是并没有说它的化石就缺失了，然而恰恰的相反，它的化石保存的很好，所以成为支持间断平衡假说的例证) The main purpose of paragraph 7 is to 目的题：句子或物体的就往前看几句；段落的话看上段末尾部分。 Learning Tips1 把自己对文章理解的脉络梳理出之后，有利于对其他文章内容的大体预测，有点麻烦，但是要坚持； 2 大概三分之一的词句仍然不能做到快速阅读和理解，多看对记忆，增加频率； 3 对做题技巧不太熟悉，回去看书吧，边看边用； 4 理解时代词注意替换成实体，不然看快了容易忘记内容到底要说什么，从句的指代词也是要替换成实体，不然加几个插入语或者长从句，容易混淆。

posts.title: TPO30-R1
posts.excerpt:
Words and Phrasessocial interaction 社会相互活动；
take the place of / substitute for/ in place of/ instead of 代替；
take place in the other circumstance 在其他的环境中发生；
developmental characteristics 发展的特点
posts.text: Words and Phrasessocial interaction 社会相互活动； take the place of / substitute for/ in place of/ instead of 代替； take place in the other circumstance 在其他的环境中发生； developmental characteristics 发展的特点 特点：characteristic/ trait/ peculiarity[pɪˌkjuliˈerəti] 特征：feature/ characteristic/ character (特征，性格，角色) most extensively 最广泛地； attention-getting(引起注意力的) behavior; maze training 迷宫训练； enriched 丰富的； impoverished 贫瘠的； weight/ size 重量、大小； synaptic[sɪ’næptɪk] connections in the brain especially the cerebellum 大脑中的突触连接特别是小脑； sage 明智的； Sentenceseg: Play is consists of leaping, running, climbing, throwing(扔), wrestling(摔跤), and other movements. eg: Exactly why animals play is still a matter debated in the research literature, and the reasons may not be the same for every species that plays. eg: Whether play occurs or not depends on the intention of the animals, and the intentions are not always clear from behaviors alone. eg: Play is not without considerable costs to the individual animal.(并无没有) eg: Great activities also increase the risk of injury in slipping or falling. eg: Thus, active play may provide necessary stimulation to the growth of synaptic connections in the brain, especially the cerebellum, which is responsible for (负责)motor functioning and movements. eg: Prey species, like young deer or goats, for example, typically play by performing(执行) sudden flight movements and turns, whereas predator species, such as cats, practice stalking(跟踪), pouncing(猛扑), and biting(咬). eg: Play can also provide practice(实践) in social behaviors needed for courtship(求爱) and mating. eg: They need to learn how to be dominant(主导的) and submissive(服从的) because each monkey might have to play either role in the future. eg: There is a danger, of course, that play may be misinterpreted（曲解） or not recognized as play by others, potentially leading to aggression. eg: Thus, many species have evolved clear signals to delineate playfulness. eg: Dogs, for example, will wag their tails, get down their front legs, and stick their behinds in the air to indicate “what follows is just for play.”(下面是逗你玩的，不过人类应该是fun，好玩) stick their behinds 撅起屁股； eg: Most of these things are learned in the long developmental periods that primates have, during which they engage in countless play experiences with their peers.(表强调) practice 实行，实践，实例； Structureintroduce the define of play—difficulties—have costs—benefit brain—explore environment—avoid misinterpretation 本篇文章先讲述了玩耍的定义，再介绍研究它的难处，再分别说它的利弊之处。 总分的结构； ExerciseLearning Tips1 逻辑分析益于把握结构，翻译利于快速阅读；

posts.title: unfamiliar expression(1)
posts.text: a very large amount of 非常多的； far more than you can handle in a single semester; a certain framework 一个确定的框架； experiment [ɪk’sperɪment] 实验； In each workbook chapter, there are two subsections. 在每个工作簿的章节中有两个小节； alternate procedures 替换步骤； rule of thumb 经验法则； beyond the weekend 超过周末； The school assigned you to a dorm and a roommate assign sb to sth 给某人指派某事； eg: You can choose either your own or your intended roommate’s number to make your room choice. intended 计划中的； make choice 做出选择； make plan to live off campus 计划离开校园； renovation 翻新 名词； eg: This event will be students’ contribution to the effort. race 种族，赛跑； a race official [ə’fɪʃ(ə)l] 赛事官员； at the student activity center / student union 在学生活动中心； administrative office / office of administration / executive [ɪɡ’zekjətɪv] office 行政办公室； ideally [aɪ’diəli] 最好，理想情况； pretty much/ well/ near 全部，非常； pretty much on a regular basis 定期； stop by 顺便到访； eg: I‘m stopping by to reserve a room for my school club that meet and work, pretty much on a regular basis. eg: We are out of private offices, but we do have some semi-private options still available. have sth adj 某事是某种状态； out of sth 没有某物了； work areas / workspace 工作区域； divider 分隔物； a couple of 一对； there’s some privacy. 有隐私； eg: We’ll work with that then, I wouldn’t want to be without an office. 我不想没办公室。 set that up 建立，创办； Here are the two forms you have to fill out. 有两个表格，你要填写； the last name of the club president 社团主席的姓； photography [fə’tɑɡrəfi] 摄影，照相术； eg: that’s not pulling up anything on the screen. 那些信息还没发调出资料来。 eg: Your club is just not showing up in my online records. faculty advisor [əd’vaɪzər] 辅导员； in the arts department 在艺术系； eg: Is this an established club? 这是一个成立了的社团吗？ No, Actually it’s a brand-new one. 不，事实上，这是一个暂新的。 eg: Have you completed the registration [.redʒɪ’streɪʃ(ə)n] process? eg: Well, for my purposes, a club definitely[‘defənɪtli] has to be registered[‘redʒɪstər] before I can proceed further. 在我这，社团必须被注册在我进一步处理前。 eg: I found everything was finalized last week. finalize 落实 eg: there’s a 24-hour turnaround ‘tɜrnə.raʊnd in our computer database. 在电脑数据库里面有一个24小时的延时。 eg: Do you have the registration approval letter from the review committee [kə’mɪti] ? 你有评审委员会的注册批准信吗？ eg: I don’t have it with me. 我没有随身携带。 eg: I think the university will give us permission to set up a website, right? establish a blog eg: you’ll be able to do that. eg: Actually there’s more. eg: You will be allowed the use of audiovisual equipment at no cost. audiovisual 视听的equipment ；at no cost 免费； post your flyers [‘flaɪər] and posters around the campus for publicity [pʌb’lɪsəti] ticket [‘tɪkɪt] 在校园里面张贴传单和海报来做宣传； be eligible for doing sth 有资格做某事； I’ll definitely follow [‘fɑloʊ]on that. 我将会好好利用这个； follow on 继续下去； that’ll work 那就行了； eg: And just so you are aware, there‘re lots of benefits to be registered. 正是如此，你要知道，还有很多的益处在注册之后。 eg: I want to get students sharing their ideas on the website, you know, establish a photography blog. get sb sharing sth 让某人分享某物； establish a photography blog 建立摄影博客； Editor’s messageNo matter how long the winter, spring is sure to follow.哈哈哈哈，笑的时候都是内伤

posts.excerpt:

posts.text: Words and Phrasesprayers 祈祷； monks 僧侣； squeezed by their walls wake 唤醒； weak 虚弱的，无力的； discrepancy 差异； discord 不和，纷争； strife 冲突，麻烦 drive out 逐出，乘车出去； sth prone to breakdown 容易坏； undermine(逐渐削弱) Catholic Church authority reckoning n 计算，估算； a new secular(世俗的) municipal(市政的) authority spoil v 宠坏，变质，溺爱；n 战利品，掠夺物；spoil of war 战利品； ingenuity 聪明才智； relentless 不停的；持续强烈的；不减弱的；不放弃的； miniaturization 微型化； notion 观念； notify 通知； Sentenceseg: Water clocks misbehaved when the temperature fell toward freezing, to say nothing of long-run drift as the result of sedimentation and clogging. Both these devices worked well in sunny climates. eg: Once known, it spread rapidly, driving out(驱逐) water clocks but not solar dials(表盘), which were needed to check the new machines against the timekeeper of last resort(最后审判). eg: From the start, however, the towns and cities took equal hours as their standard, and the public clocks installed in town halls and market squares became the very symbol of a new, secular municipal authority. eg: Tourists came to see and hear these machines the way they made pilgrimages(朝圣) tosacred relics. eg: The result was relentless pressure to improve technique and design. eg: They were thus the pioneers of mechanical engineering and served as examples and teachers to other branches of engineering.(说不定计算机的最早起源由于时钟) eg: The clock brought order and control, both collective and personal. Its public display and private possession laid the basis for(为,,,奠定了基础) temporal(时间的) autonomy(自治): people could now coordinate comings and goings without dictation(口述) from above. eg: The clock provided the punctuation marks for group activity, while enabling individuals to order their own work (and that of others) so as to enhance productivity. Topic sentencethe development of clock Structuretold time by water or sun—Catholic Church alarm—mechanic clock—development—status 本文按时间顺序讲述了时钟的发展，文章相对简单。 Exercisenothing Learning tips1 还是不喜欢整理文章结构，但是整理完之后又很high，克服心理障碍 2 做题技巧，有待提升

posts.title: TPO14-L3 (seafarers and stars)
posts.excerpt: IntroductionAt the first time, I listened to the part of the lecture in an astronomy class, I felt it so hard for me to understand, but its difficullty level is low, this is what my friend and I can not understand, at that time we think there must be some thing worng with that. And several days later, When I listened to this lecture again, I found it really easy to  understand its text structure despite there are remain many new word. Now I will tell the lecture which I’ve heard and tell you some  thing special and fascinating I searched from the Internet about pacific islanders navigation. Wish you like them too due to the fact that it is exciting for me to know there are so many difficult nations and culture real exist and they are such amazing.
posts.text: IntroductionAt the first time, I listened to the part of the lecture in an astronomy class, I felt it so hard for me to understand, but its difficullty level is low, this is what my friend and I can not understand, at that time we think there must be some thing worng with that. And several days later, When I listened to this lecture again, I found it really easy to understand its text structure despite there are remain many new word. Now I will tell the lecture which I’ve heard and tell you some thing special and fascinating I searched from the Internet about pacific islanders navigation. Wish you like them too due to the fact that it is exciting for me to know there are so many difficult nations and culture real exist and they are such amazing. LISTENING LECTUREStructureFirstly, this lecture summarizes that the fixed patterns of star is important for early seafarers, and then it takes Polynesians for example and explains the advantages of living near equator for navigation, last but not least, the lecture talks about three techniques: stone canoes, zenith star, star pairs. That’s all. ContextLISTENING LECTURE This lecture wants to talk about the importance of the stars for early seafarers, about how the fixed patterns of star were used as navigational aid. Long before the development of advance navigational tools in Europe, pacific islanders used nothing but the stars as their navigational instruments. The key to their success may be their location near the equator. what that meant was that the sky could be partitioned, divided up, much more symmetrically than it could farther away from the equator. Unlike the vikings, early observers of the stars in Polynesia or really anywhere along the equator would feel that they were at the very center of things, with the skies to the north and skies to the south behaving identically, they could see stars going straight up in the east and straight down in the west. So it was easier to discern the order in the sky than farther north or farther south, where everything would seem more chaotic. Take the case of the gilbert islands, they are part of the Polynesia, and lies very close to the equator. And the people there were able to divide the sky into symmetrical boxes, according to the main directions, north, east, south and west. And they could precisely describe the location of the star by indicating its position in one of those imaginary boxes. And they realized that you had to know the stars in oder to navigate. ​ Islanders from all over the pacific learned to use the star for navigation, and they pass this knowledge down from generation to generation. Some of them utilized stone structures called stone canoes were on the land, of course, and you can still see them on some of islands today. they are positioned as if they were heading in the direction of the points on the sea horizon where certain star would appear and disappear during the night. And young would-be navigators set by the stones at night and turn in different directions to memorize the constellations they saw, so they could recognize them and navigate by them later on when they went out to sea. ​ One important way the Polynesians had for orienting themselves was by using zenith stars. A zenith star was a really bright star that would pass directly overhead at particular latitude, at a particular distance from the equator, often at a latitude associate with some particular pacific island. So the Polynesians could estimate their latitude just by looking straight up, by observing the certain zenith star passed directly overhead at night. They’d know if they reached the latitude as a particular island they were trying to get to. ​ ​ Another technique used by the Polynesians was to look for a star pair, that’s two star that rise at the same time, and navigators could use these pairs of the star as reference points, because they rise or set together only at specific latitudes, so navigator saw one star pair setting together, they would know how far north or south of the equator they were. So looking at rising and setting star pairs is a good technique. Actually it makes more sense with setting stars. They can be watched instead of trying to guess when they’ll rise. Ok, I think all this shows that navigating does not really require fancy navigational instruments. The people of the pacific island had such expert knowledge of astronomy as well as navigation that they were able to navigate over vast stretches of Open Ocean. It’s even possible that Polynesian navigators had already sailed to the Americas,centuries before Columbus. ​ Stone tool reveals lengthy Polynesian voyage​ In 2007, Nature news had reported how could ancient Polynesians voyage on the vast stretches of Open Ocean. The news mainly describe the discovery of an adz fashioned from Hawaiian basalt on a Tuamotu atoll in French Polynesia provides the first material evidence that ancient voyagers made an 8,000-kilometre round trip from the South Pacific to Hawaii and back again. And telling us where the stone from, and mostly possible solution of why they are in Polynesia. If you have more interest, please click the link above. ​ Lost continent of the pacificThe documentary of CCTV has a film about lost continent of the pacific. It begins with a question about how ancient navigators travel more than 2000 square miles of open ocean. Scientists and adventurers found some new hints about who they are, where they come from and they may reached the Americas centuries before Columbus. What most relevant to the lecture is that islanders substantiated they can sail over vast stretches of Open Ocean using nothing but stars . Unfamiliar phrases and sentencesancient agricultural civilizations 古代农业文明； observe the stars 观察星系； keep track of the seasons 追踪季节； eg: But today, I want to talk about the importance of stars for early seafarers, about how the fixed patterns of stars were used as navigational aids. seafarer 航海员； fixed patterns of stars 固定模式的星星； navigational aids 导航助手； navigational instruments / tools 导航工具； seafaring 海上劳作的； Pacific islands 太平洋小岛；Pacific [pə’sɪfɪk] 太平洋； islander 岛民； impressive navigation skills 令人影响深刻的航海技术； navigator 航海员； use nothing but stars as their navigational instruments 仅仅使用星系作为他们的导航工具； long before the development of advanced navigational tools in Europe 早在欧洲发展先进的导航工具之前； eg: The key to Pacific islanders’ success was probably their location near the equator. 太平洋道明成功的秘诀可能是他们的位置靠近赤道。 partition [pɑr’tɪʃ(ə)n] 分割； much more symmetrically 更加对称； father away from the equator 远离赤道； eg: what that meant was that sky could be partitioned, divided up, much more symmetrically than it could father away from the equator. father away from the equator 修饰it的从句，省略了which is. eg: Unlike the Vikings, early observers of the stars in Polynesia or really anywhere along the equator would feel that they were at the very center of the things, with the skies to the north and skies to the south behaving identically, they could see the stars go straight up in the east and straight down in the west.（他们可以看到恒星笔直的在东方升起，笔直的在西边落下） star 指恒星，这里指太阳； eg: It is easier to discern the order in the sky than father north or father south, where everything would seem more chaotic. 更容易去识别顺序在天空中，比更北或更难的地方，那里的一切似乎都更杂乱无章。 take the case of sth 以…为例； lie very close to the equator 在离赤道非常远的地方； eg: The peoples of pacific islands had such expert knowledge of astronomy as well as navigation that they were able to navigate over vast stretches of open ocean. 太平洋的岛民有着如此专业的知识在天文学和航海上，他们能够在非常宽阔的海面上航行。 one star pair setting together 一对星星同时降落； make more sense with setting stars 降落的星星有更多的含义； set by 拨开； estimate their latitude just by looking straight up 估计他们的纬度只需要通过直直的向上看； pass directly overhead 直接从头顶经过； 中文版（Chinese Version）前言​ 第一次听天文学课堂上的部分讲座时，我觉得很难理解，但是它的难度等级又是低的，这是我和我的朋友不能理解的地方，那时我们觉得肯定是哪里出错了。 几天之后，当我再次听这篇讲座，我发现真的很容易去理解它的文章长结构尽管还是有很多新词。现在我将要讲诉我听到的讲座和一些我在网络上搜索到的特别的有趣的事关于太平洋岛民航海的故事。希望你也能喜欢它们因为对我来说知道有如此多不同的民族和文化真实的存在让我感到很兴奋而且他们还是那么的让人感到惊讶。 听力讲座结构​ 首先，这篇讲座总说了固定星象多早期航海者的重要性，然后它以波利尼西亚人为例解释了居住在赤道附近对于航海的优势，最后介绍了三种技术：石船，zenith星，双子星。 内容​ 这篇讲座想要谈论恒星对早期航行者的重要性，关于固定的星象是如何被使用作为航海助手的。早在欧洲发明先进的航海工具前，太平洋岛民仅仅使用星星作为航海工具。他们成功的关键可能是因为他们居住在赤道附近。这就意味着天空可以被分割得更加均匀相比于那些远离赤道到的地方。不同于维京海盗，早期的波利尼西亚的星星观察者或者说任何居住在赤道附近的人都会觉得他们在世界的中心，拥有南北两方相同的天空，他们可以看到太阳直直的从东方升起，直直的从西方落下。因此更容易去识别天空的顺序相比于更南或更北的地方，哪里的一起都会看起来更杂乱。以吉尔伯特群岛为例，它们是波利尼西亚的一部分，离赤道非常的近。那里的人们能够根据东南西北几个主要的方向把天空分成均匀的区域。他们能够准确描述腥腥的方位通过表明它的方位在其中一个想象的区域内。他们意识到为了航海必须了解星星。 ​ 整个太平洋岛的岛民学着使用星星来导航，他们一代一代的传递知识，他们中的一些人在陆地上使用称作是独木舟的石质结构，当然，你今天任然能够在一些岛屿上看到他们。他们朝着海平线的方向，其实那是固定星星在夜间出现或消失的地方。年轻的准航海者放置那些石头在夜间，转向不同的方向去记忆他们看到的星座，因此他们能够识别星星并在以后出海的时候靠它们导航。 ​ 波利尼西亚人有一个重要的方法来定位他们自己通过使用天顶星，天顶星是一个特别明亮的星星会在特定的维度直接经过头顶，且在一个特定的维度，通常这个特定的维度和一些太平洋岛屿有关。因此波利尼西亚人能够估计他们的纬度仅仅通过向上看，通过观察特定的天顶星在夜间经过头顶。他们知道他们是否到达他们想要到达的一些特定的岛屿所在的纬度。 ​ 另一个被波利尼西亚人使用的技术上寻找双子星，双子星是指两个星星同时升起，航海者能够使用它们作为参考点，因为它们只在特定的纬度同时升起或落下，因此航海者看到双子星同时降落，他们就可以知道他们离赤道向南或向北多远。因此看双星升起或降落是一种好的方法。事实上降落的双星更有意思，他们可以被观测而不用猜测它们是否升起。好的，我认为所有的这些但都表明航海并不是真的需要导航工具。太平洋岛民拥有如此专业的天文学知识和航海知识以至于他们能在开阔的海洋上航行。甚至有可能波利尼西亚人早在哥伦布数百年前就抵达过美洲。 石质工具揭示传说中的波利尼西亚航海NATURE在2007年的新闻报道了古波利尼西亚人是如何在开阔的海洋上航行的。这篇新闻主要描述了由夏威夷玄武岩制成的石锛在法属波利尼西亚岛上的土阿莫土环礁被发现，提供了第一个物证，古航海者做了一个环形8000公里的旅行从南太平洋岛到夏威夷往返。并且告诉了我们石头来着哪，它们在波利尼西亚最可能的原因。如果你感兴趣，请点击上面的链接。 复活节岛的秘密（迷失的太平洋陆地）​ CCTV有一个纪录片是关于迷失的太平洋大陆，它以一个问题开始——古航海者是如何穿越2000平方公里的开阔海域的，科学家和冒险家发现了一些新的线索关于他们是谁，他们来自哪里，他们很可能在哥伦布数百年前就到达过美洲。最和讲座相关的就是岛民证实了他们能够使用星象在开阔的海洋上航行。 Editor’s message（小编唠嗑）小编使用英文书写的时间比较短，内容和语法上可能存在一些问题，非常欢迎大家指正！ 每次碰到天文学就蒙了，碰到天文学加地理就得哭，上次天文加光谱学就已经心累了，还好有张世界地图还可以大概知道它在说哪的事。

posts.title: 你今天真好看
posts.excerpt: 《你今天真好看》是由美国作家莉兹•克里莫所画的清新暖萌漫画，主要从“我的小伙伴、过节啦、甜甜的家、一起来玩吧”四个主题的生活场景来讲述动物之间超级可爱的故事，就算是鲨鱼也很萌哦，一张图就是一个小故事，有的故事需要了解故事的背景。看的过程中小编往往会有这样的感觉，“唉，这是个笑话吗？怎么一点也不好笑，然后再认真想下，下一秒就秒变哈哈哈哈，他们是在逗么？”下面小编将会贴上四个主题的四张图来推《你今天真好看》，更多的快乐可以在书中发现。用数据说，豆瓣评分8.8。
posts.text: 《你今天真好看》是由美国作家莉兹•克里莫所画的清新暖萌漫画，主要从“我的小伙伴、过节啦、甜甜的家、一起来玩吧”四个主题的生活场景来讲述动物之间超级可爱的故事，就算是鲨鱼也很萌哦，一张图就是一个小故事，有的故事需要了解故事的背景。看的过程中小编往往会有这样的感觉，“唉，这是个笑话吗？怎么一点也不好笑，然后再认真想下，下一秒就秒变哈哈哈哈，他们是在逗么？”下面小编将会贴上四个主题的四张图来推《你今天真好看》，更多的快乐可以在书中发现。用数据说，豆瓣评分8.8。 我的小伙伴 据说可以从图中发现身边可爱的小故事哦，小编贴这张图就想到小编可爱的朋友和他的发型。 过节啦 这章里面有很多好搞笑的图，但是小编在网上发现的不多，所以就只贴了这个，故事是这样的，小恐龙对妈妈说，今年万圣节扮蛇蛇，然后往前走，一二三，装倒。哈哈哈哈，虽然不知道在时候时候经历过这个场景，不过太似曾相识啦。 甜甜的家 这章里面会有很多暖心的家庭的小日常，能在里面看到很多family会常常发生的事，也有可能是被自己忽略的小细节哦，以漫画的形式表现出来，一点也不矫情的说，也想给母上大人看看这个可爱的漫画。 一起来玩吧 会不会在笑这张图的时候发现一个，和好友玩的时候被坑的你我呢，这想想每天的生活都很精彩哦！看来每一天都应该被铭记哦！ 小编唠嗑可能看书的时候会大笑，笑完之后再看这些可爱的图，也许会和小编一样觉得这些图也以某种形式在自己的生活中出现，回想下，也会会心的一笑发现自己和朋友以前也是这么可爱，有可能可爱还在延续，嘻嘻。虽然这几天小编心情感冒了，但是看完书之后还是会觉得生活如此有趣！ 《你今天真好看》这是小编在kindle上看完的一本书，发个帖子以此纪念我的亲爱的kindle，虽然想在收到kindle的那天发帖来着，但不知道为什么就耽搁了，米啊累。但如今的他已经变成了一个有“衣服”的还有“内涵“的帅气kindle哥了，我已经给他装上了够今年可以看的书了，每晚都要看着他入睡，完全无法自拔，就是被窝看书，屏幕起雾的毛病一直存在，忧伤。
